Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of "caravans" of people coming from Central America to the Southwest border.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no "liberal (Democrat) law" for "Catch & Release" of people caught illegally crossing the border.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Mexico has the sole responsibility to stop the caravans of people, without considering other factors or actors involved in the issue.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to substantiate the statement that Mexico "must stop" the caravans of people.
Understate: The claim understates the complexities and challenges of the immigration issue by simplifying it to the actions of Mexico alone.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge alternative explanations for the increase in illegal immigration, such as economic factors or violence in Central American countries.
